revised_title: New Geological Discoveries in the Newlands Diamond Mines, Griqualand West
tldr: The author examines rock specimens from the Newlands diamond mines in Griqualand West and identifies new rock formations and minerals. They describe various types of boulders, including Saxonites, Enstatite-Eulysite, and pegmatitic hornblendic Gabbro, and provide detailed descriptions of their composition and structure. The author also discusses the matrix, or "blue ground," in which diamonds are found, and the process of decomposition that occurs in some specimens.
